hero.headline: Wake Up to the Sound of Waves and Howler Monkeys
hero.subheadline: Experience the magic of sleeping under the stars on Costa Rica's most pristine beaches. Where the jungle meets the Pacific, your adventure begins.

welcome.title: This Is Not Just Camping. This Is Living.
welcome.paragraph1: Imagine falling asleep to the rhythm of waves crashing just steps from your tent. Waking up to a symphony of tropical birds while howler monkeys call from the treetops. Watching the sun melt into the Pacific Ocean as you roast marshmallows over a crackling fire.
welcome.paragraph2: Welcome to Camping Puerto Viejo Conchal, where the boundaries between comfort and wilderness blur into something extraordinary. Nestled along the golden shores of Guanacaste, Costa Ricaâ€”just minutes from the famous white shell sands of Playa Conchalâ€”our beachfront camping sanctuary offers an escape from the ordinary and a doorway to pure, untouched nature.
welcome.paragraph3: This isn't roughing it. This is reconnecting with what matters.

location.title: Feet in the Sand, Soul in the Jungle
location.text: Our camp sits at the magical intersection where tropical dry forest meets turquoise waters. Fall asleep 50 meters from the ocean, wake up surrounded by wildlife. No resort wallsâ€”just you and nature's masterpiece.

wildlife.title: Your Neighbors Have Tails and Wings
wildlife.text: Howler monkeys announce the sunrise. Scarlet macaws paint the sky red. Toucans pose for your camera. White-faced capuchins might just visit your breakfast. This is their homeâ€”you're the lucky guest.

experience.title: Stories You'll Tell Forever
experience.text: The bioluminescent plankton lighting up the waves at midnight. The sea turtle you watched nest under moonlight. The coatimundi family that walked through camp. These moments don't happen at hotels.

flexibility.title: Your Adventure, Your Way
flexibility.text: Bring your own tent or rent one of ours. Stay one night or one month. Add a sunrise kayak tour or keep it simple. We provide the paradiseâ€”you write the story.

morning.title: Nature's Wake-Up Call
morning.text: The howler monkeys start their morning chorus as golden light filters through the palms. Step out of your tent to misty jungle air and the promise of adventure. Early birds catch sight of toucans and parrots in the canopy above.

midMorning.title: Beach Bliss
midMorning.text: After a fresh tropical breakfast, the pristine waters of Conchal await. Snorkel through crystal-clear waves, spot tropical fish, or simply float in water so clear you can see your toes. The famous shell-sand beach is your backyard.

afternoon.title: Jungle Secrets
afternoon.text: Explore hidden trails where monkeys swing overhead and iguanas sunbathe on ancient branches. Cool off in a secret swimming hole. Spot wildlife you've only seen in documentariesâ€”here, they're your neighbors.

evening.title: Sunset Rituals
evening.text: Grab your favorite drink and claim your spot on the sand. Watch as the Pacific swallows the sun in an explosion of orange, pink, and purple. No two sunsets are alikeâ€”each one is a private show just for you.

night.title: Under the Stars
night.text: Gather around the campfire as the Milky Way emerges above. Share stories with fellow travelers. Listen to the jungle's nighttime symphony. Fall asleep to waves and wake up ready to do it all again.

bringOwn.title: For the Prepared Explorer
bringOwn.text: Already have your trusty tent? Perfect. Reserve your premium beachfront campsite and set up your home-away-from-home exactly how you like it. Flat, cleared spaces with ocean views await.

rental.title: Travel Light, Sleep Right
rental.text: Flying in or prefer to pack light? We've got you coveredâ€”literally. Our quality tents come ready with comfortable sleeping pads, so you can focus on adventure, not logistics.

wildlife.title: Meet the Locals
wildlife.intro: Our camp isn't just near natureâ€”it's immersed in it. The wildlife here isn't caged or staged. These animals live here, and if you're patient and respectful, they'll share their world with you.

howler.name: Howler Monkeys
howler.text: Your natural alarm clock. These gentle giants move through the canopy at dawn and dusk, their incredible calls echoing through the forest. Spot whole families grooming and playing in the trees above camp.

macaw.name: Scarlet Macaws
macaw.text: Costa Rica's most dazzling residents. These brilliant red, yellow, and blue parrots fly in pairs over the beach at sunrise and sunset. Their calls are unmistakableâ€”and unforgettable.

toucan.name: Keel-Billed Toucans
toucan.text: The rainbow-beaked icons of the tropics. Watch them hop between branches searching for fruit, their oversized bills making them impossible to miss.

capuchin.name: White-Faced Capuchins
capuchin.text: The curious ones. These intelligent monkeys might investigate your campsite from a safe distance, their expressive faces showing endless curiosity about their human visitors.

iguana.name: Iguanas & More
iguana.text: Green iguanas sunbathing on branches, Jesus Christ lizards running across water, coatimundis foraging in groupsâ€”every walk reveals new neighbors.

wildlife.note: Important: We practice responsible wildlife interaction. Please don't feed the animalsâ€”they thrive best on their natural diet, and your respect helps keep them wild.

testimonials.title: Stories From the Sand
testimonials.subtitle: Real experiences from adventurers who found their paradise with us

sarah.name: Sarah Johnson
sarah.text: Waking up to howler monkeys and walking to the beach in secondsâ€”this was the most magical camping experience of my life. The staff was incredibly helpful and the location is absolutely stunning.

michael.name: Michael Chen
michael.text: We saw toucans, monkeys, and the most incredible sunsets. My kids are still talking about it months later. Perfect blend of adventure and comfort. Will definitely return!

emma.name: Emma Williams
emma.text: I traveled solo and felt completely safe and welcomed. The community around the campfire each night was wonderful. Made friends from all over the world. Truly life-changing.

carlos.name: Carlos Mendez
carlos.text: La experiencia perfecta para reconectarse con la naturaleza. The beach at Conchal is paradise, and having it so close to camp made every day feel like a dream.

lisa.name: Lisa Anderson
lisa.text: Worth the long flight! The wildlife here is incredibleâ€”we saw scarlet macaws every morning. The tent rentals were surprisingly comfortable and the amenities were great.

david.name: David MÃ¼ller
david.text: Best decision we made for our honeymoon. Romantic sunsets, private beaches, and the most amazing stargazing. The staff helped us arrange kayaking and snorkeling trips too.

location.title: Where Jungle Meets Ocean
location.intro: Located in the heart of Guanacaste, Costa Rica's stunning Gold Coast, Camping Puerto Viejo Conchal sits in the sweet spot between adventure and accessibility.

distances.volcano: 45 min to RincÃ³n de la Vieja

location.gettingHere: Fly into Daniel Oduber QuirÃ³s International Airport (LIR) in Liberia. Rent a car for maximum freedom to explore, or arrange a shuttle pickup directly to camp. The drive is beautifulâ€”your adventure starts the moment you land.

cta.title: Your Spot Under the Stars Is Waiting
cta.text: Every sunset is different. Every night sky tells a new story. Every day brings unexpected wildlife encounters. But campsites are limited, and the best spots go fastâ€”especially during dry season (December-April).
cta.subtext: Don't just dream about it. Don't just add it to your bucket list. Make it real.

safety.q: Is it safe to camp in Costa Rica?
safety.a: Absolutely! Costa Rica is one of the safest countries in Central America. Our camp has 24/7 security, and the local community is welcoming and friendly. Solo travelers, families, and groups all feel at home here.

packing.a: Essentials: sunscreen, insect repellent, flashlight, water bottle, and adventure spirit. Nice to have: binoculars for wildlife, waterproof bag for beach days, light layers for cooler evenings. If you're renting a tent, we provide sleeping padsâ€”just bring your own sleeping bag or rent bedding from us.

weather.a: Guanacaste has two seasons: dry (December-April) with sunny days and cool nights, and green (May-November) with afternoon showers and lush landscapes. Both are magicalâ€”dry season for guaranteed sun, green season for fewer crowds and dramatic skies.

wildlifeSightings.q: Can I see wildlife for sure?
wildlifeSightings.a: While wildlife is wild (no guarantees in nature!), our location means sightings are extremely common. Howler monkeys are heard daily, birds are constant, and most guests see multiple species during their stay. Early mornings and late afternoons are prime time.

families.q: Is this good for families with kids?
families.a: Kids LOVE it here. The beach is calm for swimming, the wildlife is endlessly fascinating, and there's space to run and explore. We've hosted families with babies to teenagersâ€”all leave with incredible memories.

rain.a: Our tents are waterproof, and we have covered common areas. A tropical rain shower is part of the experienceâ€”usually short, dramatic, and followed by the freshest air you've ever breathed. Pack a light rain jacket and embrace it!
